Creating a script to automate saving PDFs from open Chrome tabs.


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** â€¢ Edit file: h:\Books\auto_save_pdf_tabs.py</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 252, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,252 @@
- 
+ """
+ Automated PDF Tab Saver
+ Automatically saves all PDFs from open Chrome tabs and closes them.
+ Uses Chrome DevTools Protocol to interact with browser tabs.
+ """
+ 
+ import json
+ import time
+ import subprocess
+ import os
+ from pathlib import Path
+ from urllib.parse import urlparse, unquote
+ import re
+ 
+ 
+ class PDFTabSaver:
+     """Automates saving PDFs from Chrome tabs."""
+     
+     def __init__(self, save_directory="pdf"):
+         self.save_dir = Path(save_directory)
+         self.save_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+         self.chrome_debug_port = 9222
+         
+     def get_chrome_tabs(self):
+         """Get list of all open Chrome tabs using Chrome DevTools Protocol."""
+         try:
+             import requests
+             response = requests.get(f"http://localhost:{self.chrome_debug_port}/json")
+             tabs = response.json()
+             return tabs
+         except ImportError:
+             print("âš ï¸  Installing requests library...")
+             subprocess.check_call(["pip", "install", "requests"])
+             import requests
+             response = requests.get(f"http://localhost:{self.chrome_debug_port}/json")
+             tabs = response.json()
+             return tabs
+         except Exception as e:
+             print(f"âŒ Error connecting to Chrome: {e}")
+             print("\nðŸ“‹ Make sure Chrome is running with remote debugging enabled:")
+             print("   Close Chrome completely, then run:")
+             print('   "C:\\Program Files\\Google\\Chrome\\Application\\chrome.exe" --remote-debugging-port=9222')
+             return []
+     
+     def is_pdf_tab(self, tab):
+         """Check if a tab is displaying a PDF."""
+         url = tab.get('url', '')
+         title = tab.get('title', '')
+         
+         # Check URL
+         if url.lower().endswith('.pdf'):
+             return True
+         if 'pdf' in url.lower() and ('viewer' in url.lower() or 'file' in url.lower()):
+             return True
+         
+         # Check title (Chrome PDF viewer titles)
+         if 'pdf' in title.lower() and 'chrome' not in title.lower():
+             return True
+         
+         # Check if it's a PDF viewer page
+         if 'chrome-extension://' in url and 'pdf' in url.lower():
+             return True
+         
+         return False
+     
+     def extract_pdf_filename(self, tab):
+         """Extract a clean filename from the PDF tab."""
+         url = tab.get('url', '')
+         title = tab.get('title', '')
+         
+         # Try to get filename from URL
+         if url.lower().endswith('.pdf'):
+             filename = os.path.basename(urlparse(url).path)
+             filename = unquote(filename)
+             return filename
+         
+         # Try to extract from title
+         # Chrome PDF viewer titles are often: "filename.pdf - Google Chrome"
+         if '.pdf' in title:
+             match = re.search(r'([^/\\]+\.pdf)', title)
+             if match:
+                 return match.group(1)
+         
+         # Fallback: use tab title and sanitize
+         if title:
+             # Remove " - Google Chrome" or similar
+             clean_title = re.sub(r'\s*-\s*.*$', '', title)
+             clean_title = re.sub(r'[&lt;&gt;:"/\\|?*]', '_', clean_title)
+             if not clean_title.endswith('.pdf'):
+                 clean_title += '.pdf'
+             return clean_title
+         
+         # Last resort: use URL
+         parsed = urlparse(url)
+         filename = os.path.basename(parsed.path) or 'unknown.pdf'
+         filename = unquote(filename)
+         if not filename.endswith('.pdf'):
+             filename += '.pdf'
+         return filename
+     
+     def save_pdf_via_automation(self, tab, filename):
+         """Save PDF using browser automation (Selenium/Playwright)."""
+         try:
+             from selenium import webdriver
+             from selenium.webdriver.common.keys import Keys
+             from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
+             
+             chrome_options = Options()
+             chrome_options.add_experimental_option("debuggerAddress", f"127.0.0.1:{self.chrome_debug_port}")
+             
+             driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=chrome_options)
+             
+             # Switch to the tab
+             driver.switch_to.window(tab['id'])
+             
+             # Wait for PDF to load
+             time.sleep(1)
+             
+             # Send Ctrl+S to save
+             driver.find_element('tag name', 'body').send_keys(Keys.CONTROL + 's')
+             time.sleep(0.5)
+             
+             # Handle save dialog (this is tricky - may need manual intervention)
+             # For now, we'll use a different approach
+             
+             driver.quit()
+             return False
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             print(f"  âš ï¸  Automation error: {e}")
+             return False
+     
+     def download_pdf_direct(self, tab):
+         """Download PDF directly from URL."""
+         try:
+             import requests
+             
+             url = tab.get('url', '')
+             if not url:
+                 return False
+             
+             # Get the actual PDF URL (might need to handle redirects)
+             response = requests.get(url, stream=True, timeout=10)
+             response.raise_for_status()
+             
+             # Check if it's actually a PDF
+             content_type = response.headers.get('content-type', '').lower()
+             if 'pdf' not in content_type and not url.lower().endswith('.pdf'):
+                 return False
+             
+             # Extract filename
+             filename = self.extract_pdf_filename(tab)
+             filepath = self.save_dir / filename
+             
+             # Handle duplicates
+             counter = 1
+             original_filepath = filepath
+             while filepath.exists():
+                 stem = original_filepath.stem
+                 filepath = self.save_dir / f"{stem}_{counter}.pdf"
+                 counter += 1
+             
+             # Save the PDF
+             with open(filepath, 'wb') as f:
+                 for chunk in response.iter_content(chunk_size=8192):
+                     f.write(chunk)
+             
+             print(f"  âœ… Saved: {filepath.name}")
+             return True
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             print(f"  âŒ Download error: {e}")
+             return False
+     
+     def close_tab(self, tab_id):
+         """Close a Chrome tab."""
+         try:
+             import requests
+             requests.post(f"http://localhost:{self.chrome_debug_port}/json/close/{tab_id}")
+             return True
+         except Exception as e:
+             print(f"  âš ï¸  Could not close tab: {e}")
+             return False
+     
+     def process_all_pdf_tabs(self, auto_close=True):
+         """Process all PDF tabs: save and optionally close them."""
+         print("ðŸ” Finding PDF tabs in Chrome...")
+         tabs = self.get_chrome_tabs()
+         
+         if not tabs:
+             return
+         
+         pdf_tabs = [tab for tab in tabs if self.is_pdf_tab(tab)]
+         
+         if not pdf_tabs:
+             print("âŒ No PDF tabs found!")
+             return
+         
+         print(f"ðŸ“„ Found {len(pdf_tabs)} PDF tab(s)\n")
+         
+         saved_count = 0
+         failed_count = 0
+         
+         for i, tab in enumerate(pdf_tabs, 1):
+             url = tab.get('url', '')
+             title = tab.get('title', '')
+             tab_id = tab.get('id', '')
+             
+             print(f"[{i}/{len(pdf_tabs)}] {title[:60]}...")
+             print(f"  URL: {url[:80]}...")
+             
+             # Try to download directly
+             if self.download_pdf_direct(tab):
+                 saved_count += 1
+                 if auto_close:
+                     print(f"  ðŸ—‘ï¸  Closing tab...")
+                     self.close_tab(tab_id)
+                     time.sleep(0.3)
+             else:
+                 failed_count += 1
+                 print(f"  âš ï¸  Could not save (may need manual save)")
+             
+             print()
+         
+         print("="*80)
+         print(f"âœ… Saved: {saved_count} PDF(s)")
+         print(f"âŒ Failed: {failed_count} PDF(s)")
+         print(f"ðŸ“ Saved to: {self.save_dir.absolute()}")
+         print("="*80)
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """Main function."""
+     print("="*80)
+     print("PDF Tab Auto-Saver")
+     print("="*80)
+     print("\nâš ï¸  IMPORTANT: Before running this script:")
+     print("   1. Close Chrome completely")
+     print("   2. Start Chrome with remote debugging:")
+     print('      "C:\\Program Files\\Google\\Chrome\\Application\\chrome.exe" --remote-debugging-port=9222')
+     print("   3. Open all your PDF tabs")
+     print("   4. Run this script\n")
+     
+     input("Press Enter when Chrome is running with remote debugging enabled...")
+     
+     saver = PDFTabSaver(save_directory="pdf")
+     saver.process_all_pdf_tabs(auto_close=True)
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == '__main__':
+     main()
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+ import pyautogui

+ import sys

+ 
+ def install_pyautogui():
+     """Install pyautogui if not available."""
+     try:
+         import pyautogui
+     except ImportError:
+         print("Installing pyautogui...")
+         subprocess.check_call([sys.executable, "-m", "pip", "install", "pyautogui"])
+         import pyautogui
+     return pyautogui
+ 
+ 
+ def count_pdf_tabs():
+     """Count PDF tabs by checking window title."""
+     # This is a simple approach - you'll need to manually count or use Chrome extension
+     print("ðŸ“‹ How many PDF tabs do you have open?")
+     try:
+         count = int(input("Enter number: "))
+         return count
+     except ValueError:
+         return 0
+ 
+ 
+ def save_current_pdf():
+     """Simulate Ctrl+S, Enter, Ctrl+W on current tab."""
+     py = install_pyautogui()
+     
+     # Small delay to ensure we're ready
+     time.sleep(0.5)
+     
+     # Ctrl+S (Save)
+     py.hotkey('ctrl', 's')
+     time.sleep(0.8)  # Wait for save dialog
+     
+     # Enter (Confirm save)
+     py.press('enter')
+     time.sleep(0.5)  # Wait for save to complete
+     
+     # Ctrl+W (Close tab)
+     py.hotkey('ctrl', 'w')
+     time.sleep(0.3)  # Wait for tab to close
+ 
+

+     """Main automation loop."""
+     print("="*80)
+     print("PDF Tab Auto-Saver (Keyboard Automation)")
+     print("="*80)

+     print("   1. Open all PDF tabs in Chrome")
+     print("   2. Click on the FIRST PDF tab")
+     print("   3. Make sure Chrome is the active window")
+     print("   4. The script will save and close tabs automatically")
+     print("\nâ±ï¸  You have 5 seconds to click on the first PDF tab...")
+     
+     for i in range(5, 0, -1):
+         print(f"   Starting in {i}...")
+         time.sleep(1)
+     
+     print("\nðŸš€ Starting automation...\n")
+     
+     count = count_pdf_tabs()
+     
+     if count == 0:
+         print("âŒ Invalid count. Exiting.")
+         return
+     
+     print(f"\nðŸ“„ Processing {count} PDF tab(s)...")
+     print("âš ï¸  Keep Chrome window active and don't move mouse!\n")
+     
+     for i in range(count):
+         print(f"[{i+1}/{count}] Saving PDF {i+1}...")
+         try:
+             save_current_pdf()
+             print(f"  âœ… Saved and closed tab {i+1}")
+         except Exception as e:
+             print(f"  âŒ Error: {e}")
+             print("  âš ï¸  Pausing for 2 seconds...")
+             time.sleep(2)
+         
+         # Small delay between tabs
+         time.sleep(0.5)
+     
+     print("\n" + "="*80)
+     print("âœ… Done! All PDFs should be saved.")
+     print("="*80)
+ 
+
```

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,65 @@
- 
+ /**
+  * Chrome Extension Content Script
+  * Run this in Chrome DevTools Console on a PDF page
+  * Or install as a Chrome extension
+  * 
+  * To use: Open Chrome DevTools (F12), go to Console, paste this script
+  */
+ 
+ (function() {
+     'use strict';
+     
+     // Function to trigger download
+     function downloadPDF() {
+         // Get PDF URL
+         const pdfUrl = window.location.href;
+         
+         // Create download link
+         const link = document.createElement('a');
+         link.href = pdfUrl;
+         link.download = getPDFFilename();
+         link.click();
+         
+         console.log('Downloaded:', getPDFFilename());
+     }
+     
+     // Extract filename from URL or title
+     function getPDFFilename() {
+         const url = window.location.href;
+         const title = document.title;
+         
+         // Try to get from URL
+         if (url.includes('.pdf')) {
+             const urlParts = url.split('/');
+             const filename = urlParts[urlParts.length - 1];
+             if (filename.includes('.pdf')) {
+                 return decodeURIComponent(filename);
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Try to get from title
+         if (title &amp;&amp; title.includes('.pdf')) {
+             const match = title.match(/([^/\\]+\.pdf)/);
+             if (match) {
+                 return match[1];
+             }
+         }
+         
+         // Fallback
+         return 'document.pdf';
+     }
+     
+     // Auto-download when PDF loads
+     if (document.querySelector('embed[type="application/pdf"]') || 
+         document.querySelector('iframe[src*=".pdf"]') ||
+         window.location.href.endsWith('.pdf')) {
+         
+         console.log('PDF detected, downloading...');
+         setTimeout(downloadPDF, 1000); // Wait 1 second for PDF to load
+     }
+     
+     // Also provide manual function
+     window.downloadCurrentPDF = downloadPDF;
+     console.log('PDF downloader loaded. Use downloadCurrentPDF() to download manually.');
+ })();
+ 
```

```diff
+    - Most reliable
+    - Fully automated
+    - No manual intervention needed

+ 2. **If Solution 1 doesn't work:**
+    - Use Solution 2 (Keyboard Automation)

+    - One-click download per PDF
+

+

+ - Make sure Chrome is started with &#96;--remote-debugging-port=9222&#96;
+ - Close all Chrome windows first
+ - Check firewall settings
+ 
+ ### "PDF not downloading"
+ - Check if PDF requires authentication
+ - Some PDFs may be embedded (try Solution 2)
+ - Check browser download settings
+ 
+ ### "Wrong filename"
+ - Script tries to extract from URL/title
+ - You can rename files after download
+ - Or modify &#96;extract_pdf_filename()&#96; function
+ 
+ ### "Tabs not closing"
+ - Some tabs may be pinned
+ - Check if Chrome allows closing tabs programmatically
+ - May need to close manually
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ðŸ’¡ Pro Tips
+ 
+ 1. **Test with 2-3 tabs first** before processing hundreds
+ 2. **Check save location** before running
+ 3. **Backup important PDFs** before automation
+ 4. **Use Solution 1** for best results
+ 5. **Monitor first few saves** to ensure it's working
+
```

---


Created 3 solutions to automate saving PDFs from Chrome tabs:

## Solution 1: Chrome DevTools Protocol (recommended)

**`auto_save_pdf_tabs.py`** â€” Automated solution
- Finds all PDF tabs automatically
- Downloads PDFs directly
- Closes tabs after saving
- Handles duplicates

**Setup:**
1. Run `start_chrome_debug.bat` (starts Chrome with debugging)
2. Open all your PDF tabs
3. Run: `python auto_save_pdf_tabs.py`

## Solution 2: Keyboard automation (simplest)

**`save_pdf_tabs_simple.py`** â€” Simulates your manual process
- Uses `pyautogui` to press Ctrl+S, Enter, Ctrl+W
- Works like your manual workflow
- Requires Chrome to be the active window

**Setup:**
1. Open all PDF tabs
2. Click on first PDF tab
3. Run: `python save_pdf_tabs_simple.py`

## Solution 3: Chrome extension

**`save_pdf_tabs_chrome_extension.js`** â€” For manual/one-time use
- Run in Chrome DevTools console
- Or install as extension

---

## Quick start (recommended)

```bash
# Install dependencies
pip install requests

# Start Chrome with debugging
start_chrome_debug.bat

# Open all your PDF tabs in Chrome

# Run the automation
python auto_save_pdf_tabs.py
```

The script will:
1. Find all PDF tabs
2. Download each PDF to `pdf/` folder
3. Close tabs automatically
4. Show progress

**For hundreds of tabs**, Solution 1 is best â€” fully automated, no manual clicking needed.

Want me to test it or add any features?

```diff
+ """
+ Simple PDF Tab Saver Macro
+ Just simulates: Ctrl+S, Enter, Ctrl+W
+ That's it. No fancy stuff.
+ """
+ 
+ import pyautogui
+ import time
+ import sys
+ 
+ 
+ def install_pyautogui():
+     """Install pyautogui if needed."""
+     try:
+         import pyautogui
+         return pyautogui
+     except ImportError:
+         print("Installing pyautogui...")
+         import subprocess
+         subprocess.check_call([sys.executable, "-m", "pip", "install", "pyautogui"])
+         import pyautogui
+         return pyautogui
+ 
+ 
+ def save_and_close_tab(delay_between_actions=0.5):
+     """Macro: Ctrl+S, Enter, Ctrl+W"""
+     py = install_pyautogui()
+     
+     # Ctrl+S (Save)
+     py.hotkey('ctrl', 's')
+     time.sleep(delay_between_actions)
+     
+     # Enter (Confirm save)
+     py.press('enter')
+     time.sleep(delay_between_actions)
+     
+     # Ctrl+W (Close tab)
+     py.hotkey('ctrl', 'w')
+     time.sleep(delay_between_actions * 0.6)  # Slightly faster for closing
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """Main macro loop."""
+     print("="*60)
+     print("PDF Tab Saver Macro")
+     print("="*60)
+     print("\nðŸ“‹ Instructions:")
+     print("   1. Open all PDF tabs in Chrome")
+     print("   2. Click on the FIRST PDF tab")
+     print("   3. Make sure Chrome is the active window")
+     print("   4. Don't move mouse/keyboard while running")
+     print("\nâ±ï¸  Starting in 3 seconds...")
+     print("   (Click on first PDF tab NOW!)")
+     
+     for i in range(3, 0, -1):
+         print(f"   {i}...")
+         time.sleep(1)
+     
+     print("\nHow many PDF tabs?")
+     try:
+         count = int(input("Enter number: "))
+     except ValueError:
+         print("Invalid number. Exiting.")
+         return
+     
+     print(f"\nðŸš€ Processing {count} tabs...")
+     print("âš ï¸  Keep Chrome active! Don't touch anything!\n")
+     
+     for i in range(count):
+         print(f"[{i+1}/{count}] Saving tab {i+1}...", end=' ', flush=True)
+         try:
+             save_and_close_tab()
+             print("âœ…")
+         except KeyboardInterrupt:
+             print("\n\nâš ï¸  Stopped by user")
+             break
+         except Exception as e:
+             print(f"âŒ Error: {e}")
+             time.sleep(1)
+     
+     print("\n" + "="*60)
+     print("âœ… Done!")
+     print("="*60)
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == '__main__':
+     main()
+ 
```

```diff
- ## âŒ¨ï¸ Solution 2: Keyboard Automation (Simplest)
+ ## ðŸ“‹ How It Works
  
- **Best for:** Quick, simple automation
- 
- ### Setup:
- 1. **Open all PDF tabs in Chrome**
+ 1. **Open all PDF tabs** in Chrome

-    &#96;&#96;&#96;bash

- ### How it works:
- - Simulates &#96;Ctrl+S&#96; (save)
- - Simulates &#96;Enter&#96; (confirm)
- - Simulates &#96;Ctrl+W&#96; (close tab)

+    - &#96;Ctrl+S&#96; (save)
+    - &#96;Enter&#96; (confirm)

- ## ðŸ”Œ Solution 3: Chrome Extension/Console Script
- 
- **Best for:** One-time manual use or extension
- 
- ### Option A: Run in Console
- 1. Open Chrome DevTools (F12)
- 2. Go to Console tab
- 3. Paste &#96;save_pdf_tabs_chrome_extension.js&#96;
- 4. For each PDF tab, run: &#96;downloadCurrentPDF()&#96;
- 
- ### Option B: Install as Extension
- 1. Create folder: &#96;pdf-downloader-extension&#96;
- 2. Create &#96;manifest.json&#96;:
-    &#96;&#96;&#96;json
-    {
-      "manifest_version": 3,
-      "name": "PDF Auto-Downloader",
-      "version": "1.0",
-      "content_scripts": [{
-        "matches": ["&lt;all_urls&gt;"],
-        "js": ["content.js"],
-        "run_at": "document_idle"
-      }]
-    }
-    &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 3. Copy the JS code to &#96;content.js&#96;
- 4. Load extension in Chrome
- 
- ---
- 
- ## ðŸ“Š Comparison
- 
- | Feature | DevTools Protocol | Keyboard Automation | Extension |
- |---------|------------------|-------------------|-----------|
- | **Setup Complexity** | Medium | Low | Low |
- | **Automation Level** | High | Medium | Low |
- | **Reliability** | High | Medium | High |
- | **Requires Active Window** | No | Yes | No |
- | **Batch Processing** | Yes | Yes | Manual |
- 
- ---
- 
- ## ðŸŽ¯ Recommended Workflow
- 
- **For hundreds of tabs:**
- 
- 1. **Use Solution 1 (DevTools Protocol)**
-    - Most reliable
-    - Fully automated
-    - No manual intervention needed
- 
- 2. **If Solution 1 doesn't work:**
-    - Use Solution 2 (Keyboard Automation)
-    - Make sure save location is set
-    - Keep Chrome active
- 
- 3. **For future use:**
-    - Install Solution 3 as extension
-    - One-click download per PDF
+ That's it. No fancy stuff.
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## âš ï¸ Important
+ 
+ - **Keep Chrome window active** while script runs
+ - **Don't move mouse/keyboard** during execution
+ - **Make sure save location is set** (default Downloads folder)
+ - **Test with 2-3 tabs first** before doing hundreds
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ðŸ’¡ Tips
+ 
+ - If save dialog appears, make sure default location is set
+ - Script pauses 0.5 seconds between actions (adjustable)
+ - Press &#96;Ctrl+C&#96; to stop if needed
+ - PDFs save to your default Downloads folder
  
  ---
  
- ## ðŸ”§ Troubleshooting
- 
- ### "Could not connect to Chrome"
- - Make sure Chrome is started with &#96;--remote-debugging-port=9222&#96;
- - Close all Chrome windows first
- - Check firewall settings
- 
- ### "PDF not downloading"
- - Check if PDF requires authentication
- - Some PDFs may be embedded (try Solution 2)
- - Check browser download settings
- 
- ### "Wrong filename"
- - Script tries to extract from URL/title
- - You can rename files after download
- - Or modify &#96;extract_pdf_filename()&#96; function
- 
- ### "Tabs not closing"
- - Some tabs may be pinned
- - Check if Chrome allows closing tabs programmatically
- - May need to close manually
- 
- ---
- 
- ## ðŸ’¡ Pro Tips
- 
- 1. **Test with 2-3 tabs first** before processing hundreds
- 2. **Check save location** before running
- 3. **Backup important PDFs** before automation
- 4. **Use Solution 1** for best results
- 5. **Monitor first few saves** to ensure it's working
- 
- ---
- 
- ## ðŸš€ Quick Start (Recommended)
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- # 1. Install dependencies
- pip install requests
- 
- # 2. Start Chrome with debugging
- start_chrome_debug.bat
- 
- # 3. Open all PDF tabs
- 
- # 4. Run script
- python auto_save_pdf_tabs.py
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- Done! PDFs will be saved to &#96;pdf/&#96; folder.
+ ## ðŸ”§ Customize
+ 
+ Edit &#96;save_pdf_macro.py&#96; to adjust:
+ - &#96;delay_between_actions&#96; - speed of macro (default 0.5s)
+ - Save location (set Chrome's default download folder)
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ **Simple. Effective. Done.** âœ…
```

Simplified to a macro script.

## `save_pdf_macro.py` â€” keyboard macro

Does exactly what you do manually:
- `Ctrl+S` (save)
- `Enter` (confirm)
- `Ctrl+W` (close tab)
- Repeat

## Usage

```bash
# One-time install
pip install pyautogui

# Run it
python save_pdf_macro.py
```

**Steps:**
1. Open all PDF tabs
2. Click on the first PDF tab
3. Run the script
4. It repeats the macro for each tab

No requests, no Chrome debugging, no complexity â€” just a keyboard macro.

The script asks how many tabs you have, then runs the macro that many times. Keep Chrome active and don't touch anything while it runs.

Ready to use.

Updated script:

1. Shows instructions
2. Waits for you to press Enter
3. 3-second countdown (reminds you to click Chrome window)
4. Runs continuously â€” keeps doing Ctrl+S â†’ Enter â†’ Ctrl+W
5. Press Ctrl+C to stop

No tab count needed. It runs until you stop it. The script shows a count as it goes (`[1]`, `[2]`, etc.) so you can see progress.

Ready to use.

Creating a script to compare Wave 1 books with the PDFs you have:

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="write">

<details><summary>Tool use: **write** â€¢ Edit file: h:\Books\check_wave1_coverage.py</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 159, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,159 @@
- 
+ """
+ Check Wave 1 PDF Coverage
+ Compares Wave 1 books with PDFs in the pdf folder.
+ """
+ 
+ import re
+ from pathlib import Path
+ from difflib import SequenceMatcher
+ 
+ 
+ def extract_wave1_books(file_path):
+     """Extract all Wave 1 books from Ranked_Library_Waves.md."""
+     books = []
+     
+     with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+         for line in f:
+             # Match format: "0001. (W1) Title â€” Author [category]"
+             match = re.match(r'(\d+)\.\s*âœ…?\s*\(W1\)\s*(.+?)\s*â€”\s*(.+?)\s*\[', line)
+             if match:
+                 book_num = int(match.group(1))
+                 title = match.group(2).strip()
+                 author = match.group(3).strip()
+                 books.append({
+                     'number': book_num,
+                     'title': title,
+                     'author': author,
+                     'full_line': line.strip()
+                 })
+     
+     return books
+ 
+ 
+ def normalize_text(text):
+     """Normalize text for comparison."""
+     # Remove special chars, lowercase, remove extra spaces
+     text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text.lower())
+     text = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', text).strip()
+     return text
+ 
+ 
+ def similarity_score(str1, str2):
+     """Calculate similarity between two strings."""
+     return SequenceMatcher(None, normalize_text(str1), normalize_text(str2)).ratio()
+ 
+ 
+ def find_matching_pdf(book, pdf_files):
+     """Find best matching PDF for a book."""
+     book_title_norm = normalize_text(book['title'])
+     book_author_norm = normalize_text(book['author'])
+     
+     best_match = None
+     best_score = 0
+     
+     for pdf_file in pdf_files:
+         pdf_name_norm = normalize_text(pdf_file.stem)
+         
+         # Check if title appears in PDF name
+         title_score = similarity_score(book_title_norm, pdf_name_norm)
+         
+         # Check if author appears in PDF name
+         author_score = similarity_score(book_author_norm, pdf_name_norm)
+         
+         # Combined score (title weighted more)
+         combined_score = (title_score * 0.7) + (author_score * 0.3)
+         
+         # Bonus if both title and author keywords match
+         title_words = set(book_title_norm.split())
+         pdf_words = set(pdf_name_norm.split())
+         if len(title_words.intersection(pdf_words)) &gt;= 2:
+             combined_score += 0.2
+         
+         if combined_score &gt; best_score:
+             best_score = combined_score
+             best_match = pdf_file
+     
+     # Only return if confidence is reasonable
+     if best_score &gt;= 0.4:
+         return best_match, best_score
+     
+     return None, 0
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """Main comparison function."""
+     script_dir = Path(__file__).parent
+     ranked_file = script_dir / 'Ranked_Library_Waves.md'
+     pdf_dir = script_dir / 'pdf'
+     
+     print("="*80)
+     print("Wave 1 PDF Coverage Check")
+     print("="*80)
+     
+     # Extract Wave 1 books
+     print("\nðŸ“š Loading Wave 1 books...")
+     wave1_books = extract_wave1_books(ranked_file)
+     print(f"   Found {len(wave1_books)} Wave 1 books")
+     
+     # Get PDF files
+     print("\nðŸ“„ Scanning PDF folder...")
+     pdf_files = list(pdf_dir.glob("*.pdf"))
+     # Filter out .crdownload files
+     pdf_files = [f for f in pdf_files if not f.name.endswith('.crdownload')]
+     print(f"   Found {len(pdf_files)} PDF files")
+     
+     # Match books to PDFs
+     print("\nðŸ” Matching books to PDFs...")
+     matched = []
+     unmatched = []
+     
+     for book in wave1_books:
+         pdf_match, score = find_matching_pdf(book, pdf_files)
+         if pdf_match:
+             matched.append({
+                 'book': book,
+                 'pdf': pdf_match,
+                 'score': score
+             })
+         else:
+             unmatched.append(book)
+     
+     # Sort matched by score (highest first)
+     matched.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True)
+     
+     # Print results
+     print("\n" + "="*80)
+     print(f"ðŸ“Š RESULTS")
+     print("="*80)
+     print(f"\nâœ… Matched: {len(matched)}/{len(wave1_books)} books ({len(matched)/len(wave1_books)*100:.1f}%)")
+     print(f"âŒ Missing: {len(unmatched)}/{len(wave1_books)} books ({len(unmatched)/len(wave1_books)*100:.1f}%)")
+     
+     # Show some high-confidence matches
+     print(f"\nâœ… High-Confidence Matches (sample):")
+     for match in matched[:10]:
+         book = match['book']
+         pdf = match['pdf']
+         score = match['score']
+         print(f"   [{book['number']:04d}] {book['title'][:50]:50s} â†’ {pdf.name[:50]}")
+         print(f"        Score: {score:.2f}")
+     
+     # Show unmatched books
+     if unmatched:
+         print(f"\nâŒ Missing PDFs ({len(unmatched)} books):")
+         for book in unmatched[:20]:  # Show first 20
+             print(f"   [{book['number']:04d}] {book['title']} â€” {book['author']}")
+         if len(unmatched) &gt; 20:
+             print(f"   ... and {len(unmatched) - 20} more")
+     
+     # Summary by category (if we can extract it)
+     print("\n" + "="*80)
+     print("ðŸ’¡ Next Steps:")
+     print("   - Review unmatched books above")
+     print("   - Some PDFs might have different filenames")
+     print("   - Manual review recommended for accuracy")
+     print("="*80)
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == '__main__':
+     main()
+ 
```

</details>

```diff
+     "sources of power": ["Sources of Power", "Sources of Power: How People Make Decisions"],

+ 
+ def normalize_for_matching(text):
+     """Normalize text for intelligent matching."""
+     if not text:
+         return ""
+     
+     # Lowercase
+     text = text.lower()
+     
+     # Remove common PDF artifacts
+     text = re.sub(r'\s*\(pdf\)\s*', ' ', text)
+     text = re.sub(r'\s*pdf\s*$', '', text)
+     text = re.sub(r'^pdf\s*', '', text)
+     
+     # Remove edition markers but keep them for context
+     text = re.sub(r'\s*\(2e\)\s*', ' ', text)
+     text = re.sub(r'\s*2nd\s+edition\s*', ' ', text)
+     text = re.sub(r'\s*second\s+edition\s*', ' ', text)
+     
+     # Remove common prefixes
+     text = re.sub(r'^(the|a|an)\s+', '', text)
+     
+     # Remove special characters but keep spaces
+     text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', ' ', text)
+     
+     # Normalize whitespace
+     text = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', text).strip()
+     
+     return text
+ 
+ 
+ def extract_keywords(text):
+     """Extract meaningful keywords from text."""
+     normalized = normalize_for_matching(text)
+     words = normalized.split()
+     
+     # Remove common stop words
+     stop_words = {'the', 'a', 'an', 'and', 'or', 'but', 'in', 'on', 'at', 'to', 'for', 'of', 'with', 'by', 'from'}
+     keywords = [w for w in words if w not in stop_words and len(w) &gt; 2]
+     
+     return set(keywords)
+ 
+ 
+ def intelligent_match(book_title, book_author, pdf_filename):
+     """Use knowledge base and intelligence to match books to PDFs."""
+     
+     # Normalize inputs
+     title_norm = normalize_for_matching(book_title)
+     author_norm = normalize_for_matching(book_author)
+     pdf_norm = normalize_for_matching(pdf_filename)
+     
+     # Check knowledge base first
+     title_key = title_norm
+     for key, variations in BOOK_KNOWLEDGE.items():
+         if key in title_norm:
+             # Check if any variation matches PDF
+             for variation in variations:
+                 var_norm = normalize_for_matching(variation)
+                 if var_norm in pdf_norm or pdf_norm in var_norm:
+                     return True, 0.95, f"Knowledge base match: {variation}"
+     
+     # Extract keywords
+     title_keywords = extract_keywords(book_title)
+     author_keywords = extract_keywords(book_author)
+     pdf_keywords = extract_keywords(pdf_filename)
+     
+     # Check if significant title keywords appear in PDF
+     title_match_count = len(title_keywords.intersection(pdf_keywords))
+     title_match_ratio = title_match_count / max(len(title_keywords), 1)
+     
+     # Check if author keywords appear
+     author_match_count = len(author_keywords.intersection(pdf_keywords))
+     author_match_ratio = author_match_count / max(len(author_keywords), 1)
+     
+     # Calculate score
+     # Title match is more important (70%), author match (30%)
+     score = (title_match_ratio * 0.7) + (author_match_ratio * 0.3)
+     
+     # Boost score if multiple title words match
+     if title_match_count &gt;= 3:
+         score += 0.2
+     if title_match_count &gt;= 5:
+         score += 0.1
+     
+     # Boost if author matches
+     if author_match_ratio &gt; 0.5:
+         score += 0.15
+     
+     # Check for exact substring matches (high confidence)
+     if title_norm in pdf_norm or pdf_norm in title_norm:
+         score = max(score, 0.9)
+     
+     # Check for common abbreviations/acronyms
+     common_abbrevs = {
+         "ddia": "designing data-intensive applications",
+         "sre": "site reliability engineering",
+         "gtd": "getting things done",
+     }
+     for abbrev, full in common_abbrevs.items():
+         if abbrev in pdf_norm and full in title_norm:
+             score = max(score, 0.85)
+     
+     # Penalize if PDF name is too generic
+     if len(pdf_keywords) &lt; 3:
+         score *= 0.7
+     
+     return score &gt;= 0.5, score, f"Title match: {title_match_count}/{len(title_keywords)}, Author match: {author_match_count}/{len(author_keywords)}"
+ 
+ 
+ def parse_book_from_line(line):
+     """Parse book from ranked list line - fallback when intelligence fails."""
+     # Format: "0001. (W1) Title â€” Author [category]"
+     match = re.match(r'(\d+)\.\s*âœ…?\s*\(W1\)\s*(.+?)\s*â€”\s*(.+?)\s*\[', line)
+     if match:
+         return {
+             'number': int(match.group(1)),
+             'title': match.group(2).strip(),
+             'author': match.group(3).strip(),
+         }
+     return None
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """Main matching function."""
+     script_dir = Path(__file__).parent
+     ranked_file = script_dir / 'Ranked_Library_Waves.md'
+     pdf_dir = script_dir / 'pdf'
+     
+     print("="*80)
+     print("Smart Book Matcher - Using Intelligence + Parsing")
+     print("="*80)
+     
+     # Load Wave 1 books
+     print("\nLoading Wave 1 books...")
+     books = []
+     with open(ranked_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+         for line in f:
+             book = parse_book_from_line(line)
+             if book:
+                 books.append(book)
+     
+     print(f"   Found {len(books)} Wave 1 books")
+     
+     # Load PDFs
+     print("\nLoading PDFs...")
+     pdf_files = [f for f in pdf_dir.glob("*.pdf") if not f.name.endswith('.crdownload')]
+     print(f"   Found {len(pdf_files)} PDF files")
+     
+     # Match using intelligence
+     print("\nMatching using intelligence...")
+     matched = []
+     unmatched_books = []
+     used_pdfs = set()
+     
+     for book in books:
+         best_match = None
+         best_score = 0
+         best_reason = ""
+         
+         for pdf_file in pdf_files:
+             if pdf_file in used_pdfs:
+                 continue
+             
+             is_match, score, reason = intelligent_match(
+                 book['title'],
+                 book['author'],
+                 pdf_file.stem
+             )
+             
+             if is_match and score &gt; best_score:
+                 best_match = pdf_file
+                 best_score = score
+                 best_reason = reason
+         
+         if best_match and best_score &gt;= 0.5:
+             matched.append({
+                 'book': book,
+                 'pdf': best_match,
+                 'score': best_score,
+                 'reason': best_reason
+             })
+             used_pdfs.add(best_match)
+         else:
+             unmatched_books.append(book)
+     
+     # Sort by score
+     matched.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True)
+     
+     # Results
+     print("\n" + "="*80)
+     print("RESULTS")
+     print("="*80)
+     print(f"\nMatched: {len(matched)}/{len(books)} ({len(matched)/len(books)*100:.1f}%)")
+     print(f"Missing: {len(unmatched_books)}/{len(books)} ({len(unmatched_books)/len(books)*100:.1f}%)")
+     
+     # Show high-confidence matches
+     print(f"\nHigh-Confidence Matches (score &gt;= 0.8):")
+     high_conf = [m for m in matched if m['score'] &gt;= 0.8]
+     for match in high_conf[:15]:
+         book = match['book']
+         pdf = match['pdf']
+         score = match['score']
+         print(f"   [{book['number']:04d}] {book['title'][:45]:45s} -&gt; {pdf.name[:45]}")
+         print(f"        Score: {score:.2f} | {match['reason']}")
+     
+     # Show unmatched
+     if unmatched_books:
+         print(f"\nUnmatched Books ({len(unmatched_books)}):")
+         for book in unmatched_books:
+             print(f"   [{book['number']:04d}] {book['title']} -- {book['author']}")
+     
+     print("\n" + "="*80)
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == '__main__':
+     main()
+ 
```

```diff
+     "makers of modern strategy": {"title": "Makers of Modern Strategy", "author": "Peter Paret"},
+     "grand strategy of the byzantine empire": {"title": "The Grand Strategy of the Byzantine Empire", "author": "Edward N. Luttwak"},
+     "peloponnesian war": {"title": "The Peloponnesian War", "author": "Thucydides"},
+     "strategy logic of war and peace": {"title": "Strategy: The Logic of War and Peace", "author": "Edward Luttwak"},
+     "36 stratagems": {"title": "The 36 Stratagems", "author": "Anonymous"},
+     "boyd": {"title": "Boyd: The Fighter Pilot Who Changed the Art of War", "author": "Robert Coram"},
+     
+     # More
+     "rock paper scissors": {"title": "Rock, Paper, Scissors: Game Theory in Everyday Life", "author": "Len Fisher"},
+     "game changer": {"title": "Game-Changer", "author": "David McAdams"},
+     "game theory at work": {"title": "Game Theory at Work", "author": "James D. Miller"},
+     "the art of strategy": {"title": "The Art of Strategy", "author": "Avinash Dixit &amp; Barry Nalebuff"},
+     "science of strategy": {"title": "The Science of Strategy", "author": "Avinash Dixit"},
+ }
+ 
+ 
+ def normalize_for_search(text):
+     """Normalize text for searching."""
+     if not text:
+         return ""
+     text = text.lower()
+     text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', ' ', text)
+     text = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', text).strip()
+     return text
+ 
+ 
+ def find_book_match(pdf_filename):
+     """Find matching book from database using intelligence."""
+     pdf_norm = normalize_for_search(pdf_filename)
+     
+     best_match = None
+     best_score = 0
+     
+     for key, book_info in BOOK_DATABASE.items():
+         key_norm = normalize_for_search(key)
+         title_norm = normalize_for_search(book_info['title'])
+         author_norm = normalize_for_search(book_info['author'])
+         
+         # Check if key matches
+         if key_norm in pdf_norm:
+             score = 0.9
+             if title_norm in pdf_norm:
+                 score = 1.0
+             if score &gt; best_score:
+                 best_match = book_info
+                 best_score = score
+                 continue
+         
+         # Check if title matches
+         title_words = set(title_norm.split())
+         pdf_words = set(pdf_norm.split())
+         title_match = len(title_words.intersection(pdf_words))
+         
+         if title_match &gt;= 3:  # At least 3 words match
+             score = 0.7 + (title_match / len(title_words)) * 0.2
+             
+             # Boost if author matches
+             author_words = set(author_norm.split())
+             author_match = len(author_words.intersection(pdf_words))
+             if author_match &gt; 0:
+                 score += 0.1
+             
+             if score &gt; best_score:
+                 best_match = book_info
+                 best_score = score
+     
+     return best_match, best_score
+ 
+ 
+ def rename_pdf(pdf_file, dry_run=True):
+     """Rename PDF to consistent format."""
+     match, score = find_book_match(pdf_file.stem)
+     
+     if match and score &gt;= 0.7:
+         new_name = f"{match['title']} - {match['author']}.pdf"
+         new_path = pdf_file.parent / new_name
+         
+         # Handle duplicates
+         counter = 1
+         original_new_path = new_path
+         while new_path.exists() and new_path != pdf_file:
+             stem = original_new_path.stem
+             new_path = pdf_file.parent / f"{stem} ({counter}).pdf"
+             counter += 1
+         
+         if dry_run:
+             print(f"Would rename: {pdf_file.name}")
+             print(f"           -&gt; {new_path.name}")
+             print(f"           Score: {score:.2f}\n")
+         else:
+             pdf_file.rename(new_path)
+             print(f"Renamed: {pdf_file.name} -&gt; {new_path.name}")
+         
+         return True
+     
+     return False
+ 
+ 
+ def main():
+     """Main function."""
+     script_dir = Path(__file__).parent
+     pdf_dir = script_dir / 'pdf'
+     
+     print("="*80)
+     print("Intelligent PDF Renamer")
+     print("="*80)
+     print("\nThis will rename PDFs to consistent format: 'Title - Author.pdf'")
+     print("DRY RUN MODE - No files will be renamed\n")
+     
+     pdf_files = [f for f in pdf_dir.glob("*.pdf") if not f.name.endswith('.crdownload')]
+     
+     renamed = 0
+     not_matched = []
+     
+     for pdf_file in pdf_files:
+         if rename_pdf(pdf_file, dry_run=True):
+             renamed += 1
+         else:
+             not_matched.append(pdf_file.name)
+     
+     print("="*80)
+     print(f"Would rename: {renamed}/{len(pdf_files)} PDFs")
+     print(f"Not matched: {len(not_matched)} PDFs")
+     
+     if not_matched:
+         print(f"\nUnmatched PDFs (first 20):")
+         for name in not_matched[:20]:
+             print(f"  - {name}")
+     
+     print("\n" + "="*80)
+     print("To actually rename files, change dry_run=False in the code")
+     print("="*80)
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == '__main__':
+     main()
+ 
```

</details>
